function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Uncertainty about mainstreaming health criteria into public space design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing preferences and expectations about green spaces due to the pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New expectations regarding social distancing within green spaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for new or expanded exercise infrastructure within green spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of green spaces during stay at home orders may result in overcrowding and difficulty maintaining social distancing.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underused and neglected rooftop spaces may become overcrowded as people seek open air spaces for recreation and socialization.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Permanent aversion to large public gatherings","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in city design due to aversion to gatherings","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Value of large flexible spaces as assets post-covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Large gatherings and celebrations may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases due to close contact and crowding.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate planning and design of public spaces may lead to high social density, crowding, and increased public health risks.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate management of green spaces could lead to increased public health risks and a lack of access to outdoor areas for physical activity and mental well-being.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary use of green spaces for hospitals","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary road closures and changes to urban infrastructure","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in noise and air pollution during lockdown","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of spreading contagious diseases through shared transportation modes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disputes over space and competition for infrastructure among pedestrians, micro-mobility devices, and motorized vehicles","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic challenges for sharing models and service providers due to hygiene concerns and additional costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of bankruptcy and privatization of public transit systems","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interpretation of pedestrian presence as a sign of healthy public space may lead to high population density and increased risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on past data for pedestrian models may lead to inaccurate projections of public space use and potential overcrowding.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of digital data collection devices for monitoring public space usage raises legal and ethical concerns regarding privacy and surveillance.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and class differences in the use of public space may lead to unequal exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Skilled workers can shift to online work, while lower income workers may not have this choice, leading to differential exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic and social divisions may be exacerbated by the shift to telecommuting, leading to unequal use of public spaces and segregation based on class, education level, or income.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 challenges the traditional activities of public spaces, such as shopping and socializing, leading to potential changes in behavior and interactions in public areas.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Clusters of people gathering in interior and exterior spaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Altered perception of capacity due to covid-19","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transformation of interior spaces due to lockdowns","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for more exterior spaces and improved ventilation due to fears of contagion in closed indoor spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unlikely radical changes to interior environments over the short term due to heavy regulation and contextual value-laden rules.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of surveillance systems and tracking technology for outbreak control and deconfinement process","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sophisticated tracking methods may lead to invasion of privacy and surveillance concerns.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interactive maps showing infected people’s locations may lead to stigmatization and discrimination.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of location and health data for contact tracing may lead to potential misuse and exploitation of sensitive information.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to monitoring and contact-tracing app adoption","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Crackdown on civil liberties and freedom of assembly","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced attachment to public places due to prolonged absence during lockdown.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in perceptions of public spaces correlated with covid-19 impact, lockdown severity, and economic impact.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequities and exclusions in access to public spaces due to pandemic-related restrictions.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exacerbation of existing inequalities and inequities due to covid-19 impact","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation of quality public spaces in lower income neighborhoods due to absence of safety and security, controlled by criminal groups.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Religious minorities may face discrimination in public spaces due to associations between religion, class, and the spread of disease.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of people in street markets increases the risk of disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic recession and loss of income for street vendors may lead to increased vulnerability to illness","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large influx of undocumented workers in the informal sector poses a risk to public health and social stability","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of regulation and data in the informal economy in public spaces","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global interconnected settlement system","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for urban-scale regulations at a global scale","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 public health crisis impacting public space design","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
